author: Star Advertiser
title: Ground News - Gunmen take hostages at US company’s Turkish factory in apparent protest of Gaza war
text: Gunmen take hostages at US company’s Turkish factory in apparent protest of Gaza war - Gunmen have taken seven hostages at a Proctor & Gamble plant in Gebze, Turkey. - The hostages are being held while the rest of the employees have been released. - The suspects' actions are allegedly related to the conflict between Israel and [Hamas](https://ground.news/interest/hamas). Insights by Ground AI Does this summary seem wrong? 112 Articles 112 Articles All Left Center Right [] Daily Mirror 'Pro-Hamas suicide bombers' storm US-owned factory in Turkey and take hostages Two gunmen have taken seven hostages at a factory owned by US giant cosmetics giant Procter & Gamble in northwest Turkey - in protest of the Israel-Hamas war in Gaza 8 hours ago·London, United KingdomRead Full Article [] abc News Gunmen take hostages at US company's Turkish factory in apparent protest of Gaza war Media outlets say two gunmen have taken seven hostages at a factory owned by Procter & Gamble in northwest Turkey, apparently in protest of the Israel-Hamas war in Gaza 7 hours ago·United StatesRead Full Article Think freely.Subscribe and get full access to Ground NewsSubscriptions start at $9.99/year [Subscribe](/subscribe) Coverage Details Total News Sources0Leaning Left15Leaning Right22Center26Last Updated10 minutes agoBias Distribution 41% Center Bias Distribution - 41% of the sources are Center 41% Center L 24% C 41% R 35% Factuality To view factuality data please Upgrade to Premium Ownership To view ownership data please Upgrade to Vantage Sources are mostly out of (0)
